page.title: 03St.Peter's Church
page.content: A group of children visited St.Peters Church .We found that it was built before 1340.The first burial was in 1352,a man called John Wilkin who was killed by thieves.An old stone coffin has been found.This is over 1000 years old.The first school in Filton was in the Church tower.It was only big enough for 18 children.The church has a hagioscope.This is a tiny window through which poor or diseased people watched the church services.Only the wealthy were able to go inside. The church was used as a mortuary after a bomb raid on the aircraft works in 1940. Today many activities go on in the church and church hall.There are 3 Sunday services including Family worship at 10.a.m.There is a youth club, and a mothers and toddlers group.The hall can be rented.
